Romney takes Ohio, five other Super Tuesday states

(Yoon S. Byun, Globe Staff)

Elderly woman dies in Haverhill fire

One woman died and two others were injured in the early-morning, two-alarm fire in a Washington Street apartment building. (Globe, 8:52 a.m.)

Father faces charges in laser incident

Joseph Cordes of Winthrop is accused of aiming a laser pointer into the eyes of the opposing goalie at his daughter's high school hockey game. (Boston Globe)

Massachusetts teams help
reduce spread of often fatal germ

Federal disease trackers are pointing to efforts in Massachusetts that have helped slow the rate of infections caused by a life-threatening germ. (Globe)

These bloggers will tweet for food

Boston Brunchers, a food club straddling cyberspace and real life, has grown from an informal group to an influential 150-member powerhouse. So much so, that restaurants comp their meals, hoping for a positive blog or tweet. (Globe)

Two cabdrivers are seeking to force Boston and taxi fleet operators to classify drivers as employees rather than contractors and change the way they are paid.
